Subject: DPH's TevFifty - Comments (WAS: Re: [gladiator] re: Tom)

Tevildo:
Alrighty, since I know how valuable feedback is I might as well throw in my
2 cents worth :)

I went through the levels with a Cleric (Yes that is 'a', as in 1, I find
any computer controlled characters run off and die...).
I do not know if it was a legit cleric, I remember long ago playing around
with values to see what happened, and I hadn't played since then, but the
numbers for stats seemed just a little high :)

I made it through, there were a few annoying levels, many of which involved
the "No you can't go through that teleporter, there is something on the
other side" problem, which isn't anything you can fix easily :(

Lets see:
The stairs levels, very well designed, but utterly confusing as to where
they went, I ran around them for ages, and ages and ages, it was difficult
to tell which way I was supposed to be going to go up or down to the next
level/flight.  It was also difficult to navigate on foot, slightly wider
pathways would help immensely (if possible).  I remember finally abondoning
going up to the top, or whatever was supposed to be at the end, as going
round in circles is not my idea of progress :)

The ocean without a boat scenario, I tried to play it but it only ever took
1 hit to kill me.  I'm not sure if this is the way the level was designed
(ie - super-powerful monsters) or it was something to do with the game and
being over the ocean.  An exit from that level would also be nice, I
couldn't see one on the minimap, and I thought it might be a good idea to
include a link back to the dock you stepped off, we are swimming right?
Just turn around and swim back :)

Aside from that, I think the rest were good, they had a reasonably linear
plot and I especially like the garden of golden apples, I ran around it
checking out what I missed on the way through :)  Very nice idea.  There
arn't any design bugs I can remember, and many scenarios provided a
challenge - such as those where the NPC can't die, and said NPC starts
surrounded by not-so-happy nasties.  Clerics and mass-killing don't go well
together :)  The door guard at one of the castles (knox?) was good too, an
invisible barrier that fights back, it goes some way towards realism (where
you'd siege the door while taking damage), about as far as you probably can
in the game.

Overall I think they are excellent, it's good to see some levels roaming
around, especially those that have very few problems.

Cya,
Deathifier (David Storey)
- Beware, midnight brings about incoherant mumbling as sure as the sun
brings warmth to the earth.

>
> I think we can safely say that my levels DON'T suck. I haven't been
getting
> much feedback, and the site has been getting almost no traffic, but
everyone
> who's tried them (http://hotyellow98.com/tevildo/glad.html) seems to like
> them... Of course, for a permanent posting I would like to revise them one
> more time. Would someone other than DPH care to comment on them? At all?
> Just to say that you downloaded them? ...anyone?
>
>          -Tevildo, the unappreciated Prince of Cats.
